Efendi Nahi.verse 13:2: Perëndia është ai që qiejt i ka ngritur pa shtylla, e ju i shihni, e ka mbizotëruar Arshin, dhe ka nënshtruarn Diellin dhe Hënën.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:3: Ai është, i cili e ka shtrirë Tokën, duke krijuar në të male dhe lumenj.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:4: Në Tokë ka vise që janë të lidhura njëri me tjetrin dhe ka kopshtije të mbjellura me hardhi, dhe ara dhe palme me një pip ose shumë pipa; ujiten me të njëjtin ujë, e disa nga frutet i bëjnë më të shijshme nga të tjerat.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:5: E, nëse çuditesh, pra – çudi janë fjalët e tyre: “A vallë, me të vërtetë pasi të bëhemi tokë, do të krijohemi përsëri?” Ata, nuk besojnë në Zotin e tyre, këta janë ata, në qafat e të cilëve do të ketë pranga; këta janë banorët e xhehennemit, në të cilin do të qëndrojnë përherë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:6: Ata e kërkojnë me nguti prej teje të keqen para të mirës, e para tyre ka pasur shumë dënime.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:7: E, mohuesit thonë: “Sikur t’i ishte dërguar atij një mrekulli nga Zoti i tij?” ti je vetëm paralajmërues.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:8: Perëndia di se ç’mban (në barkun e saj) çdo femër, dhe di se sa shkurtohet dhe sa zgjatet (koha e lindjes).
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:9: Ai di gjërat e dukshme dhe të padukshme.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:10: Tek Ai, ju jeni të barabartë: qoftë se flisni në vete apo flisni me zë të lartë, si dhe ai që fshihet natën apo ai që ecë ditën.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:11: Njeriu ka përcjellës (engjëj), para tij dhe pas tij, - e mbikëqyrin atë me urdhërin e Perëndisë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:12: Ai ua dëfton juve vetëtimën, duke u frikësuar dhe shpresuar ju, dhe Ai krijon re të rënda (me shi).
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:13: Edhe bubullima e falenderon Ate (Perëndinë), por edhe engjëjt, nga droja ndaj Tij; Ai dërgon rrëfetë dhe godet me ato kë të dojë; - dhe ata përsëri diskutojnë për Perëndinë, e Ai është i ashpër në ndëshkime.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:14: Vetëm për Te është lutja e vërtetë! E, ata (mohuesit) që i luten tjetërkujt – përpos Perëndisë, nuk u përgjigjet atyre me kurrgjë, ashtu sikundër ai që i zgjatë dy duart tek uji (pranë pusit), për t’i ardhur te goja; por, ai, kurrsesi nuk i vjen.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:15: Perëndisë i bëjnë sexhde të gjithë ata që gjenden në qiej dhe në Tokë, dashtë e padashtë, si dhe hijet e tyre (bëjnë sexhde), në mëngjes dhe në mbrëmje.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:16: Thuaj: “Kush është Zoti i qiellërave dhe i Tokës?” – dhe përgjigju: “Perëndia!” Thuaj: “A mos vallë, i merrni ju, përveç Tij, për miq, ata që vetes nuk mund t’i sjellin as dobi as dëm?” Thuaj: A janë të njëjtë i verbëti dhe ai që sheh, ose, a janë të njëjtë errësirat dhe drita, ose, mos vallë, ata që i kanë bërë shok Perëndisë, a kanë krijuar siç ka krijuar Ai, e që t’ju bëhen krijesat e ngjashme atyre?” Thuaj: “Perëndia, është krijues i çdo gjëje dhe Ai është i Vetmi dhe Triumfues”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:17: Ai lëshon shiun nga qielli, andaj rrjedhin lumenjtë me masë (të caktuar), dhe vala i bartë mbeturinat mbi sipërfaqe të ujit.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:18: Për ata që i gjegjen Zotit të tyre, i gjen e mira e madhe, e ata që nuk i gjegjen Atij – sikur të ishte e tyre e gjithë ç’ka në Tokë, dhe edhe aq (më tepër), ata do ta sakrifikonin atë (për të shpëtuar).
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:19: A mos vallë, ai që di se e vërteta që të është shpallë ty nga Zoti yt është njësoj sikur ai që është i verbër? Vetëm të mençurit mendojnë:
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:20: Ata që kryejnë obligimin ndaj Perëndisë dhe nuk e prishin premtimin;
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:21: dhe ata që ruajnë atë që ka urdhëruar Perëndia që të ruhet dhe i druajnë Zotit të tyre, dhe i frikohen llogarisë së rëndë;
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:22: dhe ata që durojnë për të fituar dashurinë e Zotit të tyre, dhe që falin namazin, dhe nga ajo që ua kemi dhënë Ne – ndajnë (japin) fshehurazi dhe haptazi, dhe kthejnë të keqen me të mirë – për ta ka përfundim të mirë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:23: Xhenneti i Adnit, në të cilin do të hyjnë ata, dhe prindërit e tyre, dhe gratë e tyre, dhe pasardhësit e tyre – ata ë kanë qenë të mirë (që kanë besuar), e engjëjt do të hyjnë tek ata nga çdo derë:
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:24: (e ju thonë): “Shpëtimi qoftë mbi ju, meqë keni duruar, e sa përfundim i bukur që është ky!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:25: E, ata që prishin obligimin ndaj Perëndisë, pasi që janë zotuar për atë, e që këputin atë që ka urdhëruar Perëndia të ruhet, dhe bëjnë çrregullime në Tokë – për ata ka mallkim dhe përfundim të keq!
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:26: Perëndia ia zgjëron furnizimin kujt të dojë dhe ia pakson.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:27: Mohuesit thonë: “Sikur t’i ishte dërguar atij një mrekulli nga Zoti i tij?” Thuaj: “Me të vërtetë, Perëndia e shpie në humbje atë që don (meqë është zhytur në të keqe), ndërsa e udhëzon në rrugë të drejtë atë që kthehet tek Ai,
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:28: ata që besojnë dhe zemrat e të cilëve, kur përmendet Perëndia, qetësohen – e, me të vërtetë, kur të përmendet Perëndia, zemrat qetësohen!
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:29: Ata që besojnë dhe punojnë vepra të mira, të lumtë ata; për ta ka vendbanim të mrekullueshëm!
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:30: Dhe, kështu të dërguam Ne ty te një popull, para të cilit kanë kaluar shumë popuj, që t’jua lexosh ti atyre, atë që ta kemi shpallur Na ty, sepse ata nuk besojën në Mëshiruesin (Perëndinë).
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:31: Sikur me ndonjë Kur’an të lëviznin malet ose me të – të copëtohet toka ose me të – të flisnin të vdekurit (të ngjalleshin, atëherë, edhe me këtë Kur’an do të bëheshin këto).
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:32: Edhe para teje, janë tallë me pejgamberë, andaj Unë u kam dhënë afat atyre që kanë mohuar, e pastaj i kam ndëshkuar, e çfarë ka qenë dënimi Im!
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:33: A mos vallë, Atij që është mbikëqyrës për çdokënd – çka punon, mund t’i bëhet shok – ai që nuk di asgjë, (siç konsiderojnë mohuesit)? Ose ju doni ta lajmëroni Ate, për atë çka nuk di Ai (Perëndia) në Tokë, (kurse Ai di edhe për më të voglën imtësi), ose (po i emroni ju ata) me fjalë boshe? Jo, por mohuesve dinakëritë e veta i hijeshohen dhe ata janë larguar nga rruga e drejtë, e kë e shmangë Perëndia, për te s’ka udhërrëfyes.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:34: Për ta ka dënim në këtë jetë, por dënimi në jetën tjetër, me siguri, është edhe më i ashpër, dhe për ta, s’ka mbrojtës nga dënimi i Perëndisë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:35: Xhenneti i tillë, që u është premtuar muslimanëve: ka (kopshtije) nëpër të cilat rrjedhin lumenj, frutet e kopshtit janë të përhershme, si dhe freskia e tij.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:36: E, atyre që ua kemi zbritur Librin, ata gëzohen për atë që të kemi shpallë ty.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:37: Ja, kështu, Na e kemi zbritur Kur’anin – ligj (të mençurisë së shprehur) në gjunë arabe.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:38: Na, me të vërtetë, edhe para teje kemi dërguar pejgamberë dhe u kemi dhënë gra dhe pasardhës.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:39: Perëndia shlyen çka të dojë e themelon çka të dojë; dhe tek Ai është Libri kryesor.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:40: Qoftë të të tregojmë Na ty, nga ajo që u kemi premtuar atyre, ose ta marrim shpirtin Na ty, ti je i obliguar vetëm ta shpallish (profetninë tënde e jo dënimin e tyre), se llogaria është te Ne.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:41: A nuk po shohin ata, që Ne po ua shkatërrojmë tokën (mohuesve), duke i zvogluar skajet e saj.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:42: Dredhi kanë bërë edhe ata që kanë qenë para tyre, e Perëndia është zotërues i të gjitha dredhive.
Efendi Nahi.verse 13:43: Mohuesit thonë: “Ti nuk je pejgamber!” Thuaj (o Muhammed!): “Mjafton Perëndia për dëshmitar në mes meje dhe jush, dhe Ai që e di Librin”.

null.verse 13:1: Əlif, Lam, Mim, Pa! Bunlar Kitabın (Qur'anın) ayələridir.
null.verse 13:2: Gördüyünüz göyləri dirəksiz olaraq yüksəldən, sonra ərşi yaradıb hökmü altına alan (ərş üzərində bərqərar olan), müəyyən vaxta (dünyanın axırına - qiyamətə) qədər (səmada) dolanan Günəşi və Ayı ram edən, bütün işləri yoluna qoyan, ayələri müfəssəl izah edən məhz Allahdır.
null.verse 13:3: Yeri (insanların və başqa canlıların yaşaya bilməsi üçün) döşəyən (uzadıb genəldən), orada möhkəm dağlar, çaylar yaradan, bütün meyvələrdən (erkək-dişi, yaxud şirin-acı, turş-meyxoş və s.
null.verse 13:4: Yer üzündə bir-birinə yaxın (qonşu) qitələr (münbit, qeyri-münbit, şirin-şoran, dağlıq-aran yerlər, müxtəlif iqlimli torpaq sahələri), eyni su ilə sulanan üzüm bağları, əkinlər, şaxəli-şaxəsiz xurma ağacları vardır.
null.verse 13:5: (Ya Rəsulum!) Əgər (müşriklərə) təəccüblənirsənsə, əsl təəccübləniləsi (əsl təəccüb doğuran şey) onların: "Biz torpaq olduqdan sonra yenidənmi yaradılacağıq?" - söyləməsidir.
null.verse 13:6: (Müşriklər) səni tələsdirib (özlərinə) yaxşılıqdan əvvəl pislik (Allahın mərhəmətindən qabaq əzabını) istəyirlər.
null.verse 13:7: Kafir olanlar: "Məgər ona Rəbbindən bir mö'cüzə endirilməli deyildimi?" - deyirlər.
null.verse 13:8: Allah hər bir dişi məxluqun (bətnində) nə daşıdığını (oğlan, yaxud qız doğacağını), bətnlərin nəyi əskildib, nəyi artıracağını (qadınların bari-həmlini doqquz aydan tez, yaxud gec yerə qoyacağını, doğulacaq uşağın sağlam və xəstə olacağını, çox, yaxud az yaşayacağını) bilir.
null.verse 13:9: O, qeybi də, aşkarı da biləndir, (hər şeydən) böyükdür, ucadır! (Allah eyibsizdir, nöqsansızdır.
null.verse 13:10: Sizdən sözünü gizlədən də, onu açıq deyəndə, gecənin qoynunda gizlənən də, gündüz aşkar gəzib dolanan da (Allah üçün) eynidir.
null.verse 13:11: (İnsan üçün) onu öndən və arxadan tə'qib edənlər (mələklər) vardır.
null.verse 13:12: Sizə qorxu və ümid (bir tərəfdən ildırımın verəcəyi tələfatdan qorxmaq, digər tərəfdən də yağış istəmək) məqsədilə şimşək göstərən, (yağışla yüklənmiş) ağır buludları yaradan da Odur.
null.verse 13:13: Göy gurultusu Onun şə'ninə tə'riflər deyir, mələklər də (Allahın) qorxusundan (Onu öyüb mədh edirlər).
null.verse 13:14: Haqq olan (qəbul edilən) dua yalnız Ona (Allaha) olan duadır.
null.verse 13:15: Göylərdə və yerdə kim varsa, (özləri də), kölgələri də səhər-axşam istər-istəməz Allaha səcdə edər! (Yer üzündəki mö'minlər sidqi-ürəkdən, kafirlər və münafiqlər isə ürəkdən istəməyərək, lakin dünyada müəyyən bir mənfəət əldə etmək xatirinə və ya kiminsə, nəyinsə qorxusundan Allaha səcdə edərlər!)
null.verse 13:16: (Ya Rəsulum!) De: "Göylərin və yerin Rəbbi kimdir?" (Kafirlər bu sualın qarşısında aciz qaldıqda) de: "Allahdır!" De: "Belə olduqda, Onu qoyub özlərinə nə bir xeyir, nə də bir zərər verə bilənlərimi (bütləri, tanrılarımı) özünüzə dost (hami) edirsiniz?!" De: "Heç korla görən (kafirlə mö'min) və ya zülmətlə nur (küfrlə iman) eyni ola bilərmi?! Yoxsa onlar (müşriklər) Allaha Onun yaratdığı kimi yaradan şəriklər qərar verdilər və onların nəzərincə bu yaratma bir-birinə bənzər göründü?!" De: "Allah hər şeyin xaliqidir.
null.verse 13:17: Allah göydən bir yağmur endirdi, vadilər öz tutumlarına görə onunla dolub daşdı.
null.verse 13:18: Rəbbinin də'vətini qəbul edənləri (Allaha və Onun Peyğəmbərinə itaət edənləri) ən gözəl ne'mət (Cənnət) gözləyir.
null.verse 13:19: (Ya Rəsulum!) Rəbbindən sənə nazil edilənin (Qur'anın) haqq olduğunu bilən kimsə (haqqı görməyən) korla eyni ola bilərmi? Yalnız ağıl sahibləri öyüd-nəsihət qəbul edərlər!
null.verse 13:20: O kəslər ki, Allaha (yalnız Ona ibadət edəcəkləri barədə) verdikləri və'di yerinə yetirir və əhdi pozmurlar.
null.verse 13:21: O kəslər ki, Allahın birləşdirilməsini əmr etdiyi şeyləri birləşdirir (qohumluq əlaqələrini qoruyub saxlayır, mö'minlərə hörmət edir), Rəbbindən və (qiyamət günü çəkiləcək) pis haqq-hesabdan qorxurlar.
null.verse 13:22: Və o kəslər ki, Rəbbinin razılığını qazanmaq üçün (bu yolda bütün əziyyətlərə) səbr edir, (vaxtlı-vaxtında, lazımınca) namaz qılır, onlara verdiyimiz ruzidən (yoxsullara, ehtiyacı olanlara) gizli və aşkar xərcləyir, pisliyin qarşısını yaxşılıq etməklə alırlar (pisliyin əvəzində yaxşılıq edirlər) - məhz onları (gözəl) axirət yurdu -
null.verse 13:23: ?zlərinin, həmçinin əməlisaleh ataları, övrətləri və övladlarının daxil olacaqları Ədn cənnətləri gözləyir.
null.verse 13:24: "(Dünyada Allah yolunda bütün çətinliklərə) səbr etdiyinizə görə sizə salam olsun! Axirət yurdu (Cənnət) nə gözəldir!" - deyəcəklər.
null.verse 13:25: Allahla əhd bağladıqdan sonra onu pozanlar, Allahın birləşdirilməsini əmr etdiyi şeyləri (qohumluq əlaqələrini) qıranlar, yer üzündə fitnə-fəsad törədənlər isə lə'nətə düçar olacaqlar.
null.verse 13:26: Allah istədiyi bəndənin ruzisi bol da edər, azaldar da.
null.verse 13:27: Kafir olanlar: "Məgər Rəbbindən ona bir mö'cüzə endirilməli deyildimi?" - deyirlər.
null.verse 13:28: O kəslər ki, Allaha iman gətirmiş və qəlbləri Allahı zikr etməklə aram tapmışdır.
null.verse 13:29: İman gətirib yaxşı işlər görənlərin xoş halına! (Onları) gözəl bir sığınacaq (Cənnət gözləyir)!
null.verse 13:30: (Ya Rəsulum! Səndən əvvəl peyğəmbərlər göndərdiyimiz kimi) səni də özündən əvvəl çoxlu ümmətlər gəlib-getmiş bir ümmətə Peyğəmbər göndərdik ki, onlar Rəhmanı (Allahı) inkar etdikləri halda, sənə vəhy etdiyimiz (Qur'anı) onlara oxuyasan.
null.verse 13:31: Əgər Qur'anla dağlar hərəkətə gətirilsə, yaxud yer parçalansa və ya ölülər danışsaydılar (onlar yenə də iman gətirməzdilər).
null.verse 13:32: (Ya Rəsulum!) Səndən əvvəl gəlib-gedən peyğəmbərlərə də istehza edilmişdi.
null.verse 13:33: Hər bir kəsin (dünyada yaxşıdan, pisdən) nə qazandığına nəzarət edən Allah bunu bacarmayan bütlər kimidirmi?! (Əsla yox!) (Bununla belə, müşriklər götürüb) Allaha (cürbəcür) şəriklər qoşdular.
null.verse 13:34: Onlar dünyada əzaba düçar olacaqlar.
null.verse 13:35: Allahdan qorxub pis əməllərdən çəkinənlərə (mö'minlərə) və'd edilən Cənnətin vəsfi belədir: (ağacları) altından çaylar axar, yeməkləri də, kölgələri də daimidir.
null.verse 13:36: Kitab verdiklərimiz (kitab əhlinin sənə iman gətirənləri) sənə nazil etdiyimizə (Qur'ana) sevinirlər.
null.verse 13:37: (Ya Rəsulum!) Beləliklə, Biz onu (Qur'anı) ərəbcə bir hökm olaraq (insanlar arasında onunla hökm etmək üçün) nazil etdik.
null.verse 13:38: (Ya Rəsulum!) Biz səndə əvvəl də Peyğəmbərlər göndərdik, onlara zövcələr, övladlar verdik.
null.verse 13:39: Allah (həmin kitabdan) istədiyi şeyi məhv edər, istədiyini də sabit saxlayar (bəndələrinə aid hər hansı bir hökmü ləğv edib başqası ilə dəyişər və ya onu olduğu kimi saxlayar).
null.verse 13:40: Onlara və'd etdiyimizin (əzabın) bir qismini sənə göstərsək də və ya (ondan qabaq) səni öldürsək də (?z dərgahımıza götürsək də, fərq etməz).
null.verse 13:41: Məgər onlar (kafirlər) Bizim (hökmümüzlə, qüdrətimizlə) yer üzünə gəlib onu (müxtəlif) tərəflərindən əskiltdiyimizi (müsəlmanların get-gedə onların torpaqlarını fəth etdiklərini) görmürlərmi? Hökm edən Allahdır.
null.verse 13:42: Onlardan əvvəlkilər də (ümmətlər, tayfalar da Allahın peyğəmbərinə qarşı) tələ qururdular.
null.verse 13:43: (Ya Rəsulum!) Kafirlər: "Sən peyğəmbər deyilsən!" - deyirlər.

null.verse 13:2: Allah je nebesa, vidite ih, bez stubova podigao, i onda svemirom zavladao, i Sunce i Mjesec potčinio, svako se kreće do roka određenog; On upravlja svim i potanko izlaže dokaze da biste se uvjerili da ćete pred Gospodara svoga sta
null.verse 13:3: On je Zemlju ravnom učinio i na njoj nepomične planine i rijeke stvorio i od svakog ploda po par, muško i žensko, dao; On dan zastire noću.

null.verse 13:16: জিজ্ঞেস করুন নভোমন্ডল ও ভুমন্ডলের পালনকর্তা কে? বলে দিনঃ আল্লাহ! বলুনঃ তবে কি তোমরা আল্লাহ ব্যতীত এমন অভিভাবক স্থির করেছ, যারা নিজেদের ভাল-মন্দের ও মালিক নয়? বলুনঃ অন্ধ চক্ষুষ্মান কি সমান হয়? অথবা কোথাও কি অন্ধকার ও আলো সমান হয়। তবে কি তারা আল্লাহর জন্য এমন অংশীদার স্থির করেছে যে, তারা কিছু সৃষ্টি করেছে, যেমন সৃষ্টি করেছেন আল্লাহ? অতঃপর তাদের সৃষ্টি এরূপ বিভ্রান্তি ঘটিয়েছে? বলুনঃ আল্লাহই প্রত্যেক বস্তুর স্রষ্টা এবং তিনি একক, পরাক্রমশালী।
null.verse 13:17: তিনি আকাশ থেকে পানি বর্ষণ করেন। অতঃপর স্রোতধারা প্রবাহিত হতে থাকে নিজ নিজ পরিমাণ অনুযায়ী। অতঃপর স্রোতধারা স্ফীত ফেনারাশি উপরে নিয়ে আসে। এবং অলঙ্কার অথবা তৈজসপত্রের জন্যে যে বস্তুকে আগুনে উত্তপ্ত করে, তাতেও তেমনি ফেনারাশি থাকে। এমনি ভাবে আল্লাহ সত্য ও অসত্যের দৃষ্টান্ত প্রদান করেন। অতএব, ফেনা তো শুকিয়ে খতম হয়ে যায় এবং যা মানুষের উপকারে আসে, তা জমিতে অবশিষ্ট থাকে। আল্লাহ এমনিভাবে দৃষ্টান্তসমূহ বর্ণনা করেন।
null.verse 13:18: যারা পালনকর্তার আদেশ পালন করে, তাদের জন্য উত্তম প্রতিদান রয়েছে এবং যারা আদেশ পালন করে না, যদি তাদের কাছে জগতের সবকিছু থাকে এবং তার সাথে তার সমপরিমাণ আরও থাকে, তবে সবই নিজেদের মুক্তিপণ স্বরূপ দিয়ে দেবে। তাদের জন্যে রয়েছে কঠোর হিসাব। তাদের আবাস হবে জাহান্নাম। সেটা কতইনা নিকৃষ্ট অবস্থান।
null.verse 13:19: যে ব্যক্তি জানে যে, যা কিছু পালনকর্তার পক্ষ থেকে আপনার প্রতি অবর্তীর্ণ হয়েছে তা সত্য সে কি ঐ ব্যক্তির সমান, যে অন্ধ? তারাই বোঝে, যারা বোধশক্তি সম্পন্ন।
null.verse 13:20: এরা এমন লোক, যারা আল্লাহর প্রতিশ্রুতি পূর্ণ করে এবং অঙ্গীকার ভঙ্গ করে না।
null.verse 13:21: এবং যারা বজায় রাখে ঐ সম্পর্ক, যা বজায় রাখতে আল্লাহ আদেশ দিয়েছেন এবং স্বীয় পালনকর্তাকে ভয় করে এবং কঠোর হিসাবের আশঙ্কা রাখে।
null.verse 13:22: এবং যারা স্বীয় পালনকর্তার সন্তুষ্টির জন্যে সবর করে, নামায প্রতিষ্টা করে আর আমি তাদেরকে যা দিয়েছি, তা থেকে গোপনে ও প্রকাশ্য ব্যয় করে এবং যারা মন্দের বিপরীতে ভাল করে, তাদের জন্যে রয়েছে পরকালের গৃহ।
null.verse 13:23: তা হচ্ছে বসবাসের বাগান। তাতে তারা প্রবেশ করবে এবং তাদের সৎকর্মশীল বাপ-দাদা, স্বামী-স্ত্রী ও সন্তানেরা। ফেরেশতারা তাদের কাছে আসবে প্রত্যেক দরজা দিয়ে।
null.verse 13:24: বলবেঃ তোমাদের সবরের কারণে তোমাদের উপর শান্তি বর্ষিত হোক। আর তোমাদের এ পরিণাম-গৃহ কতই না চমৎকার।
null.verse 13:25: এবং যারা আল্লাহর অঙ্গীকারকে দৃঢ় ও পাকা-পোক্ত করার পর তা ভঙ্গ করে, আল্লাহ যে, সম্পর্ক বজায় রাখতে আদেশ করেছেন, তা ছিন্ন করে এবং পৃথিবীতে অশান্তি সৃষ্টি করে, ওরা ঐ সমস্ত লোক যাদের জন্যে রয়েছে অভিসম্পাত এবং ওদের জন্যে রয়েছে কঠিন আযাব।
null.verse 13:26: আল্লাহ যার জন্যে ইচ্ছা রুযী প্রশস্ত করেন এবং সংকুচিত করেন। তারা পার্থিব জীবনের প্রতি মুগ্ধ। পার্থিবজীবন পরকালের সামনে অতি সামান্য সম্পদ বৈ নয়।
null.verse 13:27: কাফেররা বলেঃ তাঁর প্রতি তাঁর পালনকর্তার পক্ষ থেকে কোন নিদর্শন কেন অবতীর্ণ হলো না? বলে দিন, আল্লাহ যাকে ইচ্ছা পথভ্রষ্ট করেন এবং যে, মনোনিবেশ করে, তাকে নিজের দিকে পথপ্রদর্শন করেন।
null.verse 13:28: যারা বিশ্বাস স্থাপন করে এবং তাদের অন্তর আল্লাহর যিকির দ্বারা শান্তি লাভ করে; জেনে রাখ, আল্লাহর যিকির দ্বারাই অন্তর সমূহ শান্তি পায়।
null.verse 13:29: যারা বিশ্বাস স্থাপন করে এবং সৎকর্ম সম্পাদন করে, তাদের জন্যে রয়েছে সুসংবাদ এবং মনোরম প্রত্যাবর্তণস্থল।
null.verse 13:30: এমনিভাবে আমি আপনাকে একটি উম্মতের মধ্যে প্রেরণ করেছি। তাদের পূর্বে অনেক উম্মত অতিক্রান্ত হয়েছে। যাতে আপনি তাদেরকে ঐ নির্দেশ শুনিয়ে দেন, যা আমি আপনার কাছে প্রেরণ করেছি। তথাপি তারা দয়াময়কে অস্বীকার করে। বলুনঃ তিনিই আমার পালনকর্তা। তিনি ব্যতীত কারও উপাসনা নাই। আমি তাঁর উপরই ভরসা করেছি এবং তাঁর দিকেই আমার প্রত্যাবর্তণ।
null.verse 13:31: যদি কোন কোরআন এমন হত, যার সাহায্যে পাহাড় চলমান হয় অথবা যমীন খন্ডিত হয় অথবা মৃতরা কথা বলে, তবে কি হত? বরং সব কাজ তো আল্লাহর হাতে। ঈমানদাররা কি এ ব্যাপারে নিশ্চিত নয় যে, যদি আল্লাহ চাইতেন, তবে সব মানুষকে সৎপথে পরিচালিত করতেন? কাফেররা তাদের কৃতকর্মের কারণে সব সময় আঘাত পেতে থাকবে অথবা তাদের গৃহের নিকটবর্তী স্থানে আঘাত নেমে আসবে, যে, পর্যন্ত আল্লাহর ওয়াদা না আসে। নিশ্চয় আল্লাহ ওয়াদার খেলাফ করেন না।
null.verse 13:32: আপনার পূর্বে কত রাসূলের সাথে ঠাট্টা করা হয়েছে। অতঃপর আমি কাফেরদেরকে কিছু অবকাশ দিয়েছি। , এর পর তাদেরকে পাকড়াও করেছি। অতএব কেমন ছিল আমার শাস্তি।
null.verse 13:33: ওরা প্রত্যেকেই কি মাথার উপর স্ব স্ব কৃতকর্ম নিয়ে দন্ডায়মান নয়? এবং তারা আল্লাহর জন্য অংশীদার সাব্যস্ত করে। বলুন; নাম বল অথবা খবর দাও পৃথিবীর এমন কিছু জিনিস সম্পর্কে যা তিনি জানেন না? অথবা অসার কথাবার্তা বলছ? বরং সুশোভিত করা হয়েছে কাফেরদের জন্যে তাদের প্রতারণাকে এবং তাদেরকে সৎপথ থেকে বাধা দান করা হয়েছে। আল্লাহ যাকে পথভ্রষ্ট করেন, তার কোন পথ প্রদর্শক নেই।
null.verse 13:34: দুনিয়ার জীবনেই এদের জন্য রয়েছে আযাব এবং অতি অবশ্য আখেরাতের জীবন কঠোরতম। আল্লাহর কবল থেকে তাদের কোন রক্ষাকারী নেই।
null.verse 13:35: পরহেযগারদের জন্যে প্রতিশ্রুত জান্নাতের অবস্থা এই যে, তার নিম্নে নির্ঝরিণীসমূহ প্রবাহিত হয়। তার ফলসমূহ চিরস্থায়ী এবং ছায়াও। এটা তাদের প্রতিদান, যারা সাবধান হয়েছে এবং কাফেরদের প্রতিফল অগ্নি।
null.verse 13:36: এবং যাদেরকে আমি গ্রন্থ দিয়েছি, তারা আপনার প্রতি যা অবতীর্ণ হয়েছে, তজ্জন্যে আনন্দিত হয় এবং কোন কোন দল এর কোন কোন বিষয় অস্বীকার করে। বলুন, আমাকে এরূপ আদেশই দেয়া হয়েছে যে, আমি আল্লাহর এবাদত করি। এবং তাঁর সাথে অংশীদার না করি। আমি তাঁর দিকেই দাওয়াত দেই এবং তাঁর কাছেই আমার প্রত্যাবর্তন।
null.verse 13:37: এমনিভাবেই আমি এ কোরআনকে আরবী ভাষায় নির্দেশরূপে অবতীর্ণ করেছি। যদি আপনি তাদের প্রবৃত্তির অনুসরণ করেন আপনার কাছে জ্ঞান পৌঁছার পর, তবে আল্লাহর কবল থেকে আপনার না কোন সাহায্যকারী আছে এবং না কোন রক্ষাকারী।
null.verse 13:38: আপনার পূর্বে আমি অনেক রসূল প্রেরণ করেছি এবং তাঁদেরকে পত্নী ও সন্তান-সন্ততি দিয়েছি। কোন রসূলের এমন সাধ্য ছিল না যে আল্লাহর নির্দেশ ছাড়া কোন নিদর্শন উপস্থিত করে। প্রত্যেকটি ওয়াদা লিখিত আছে।
null.verse 13:39: আল্লাহ যা ইচ্ছা মিটিয়ে দেন এবং বহাল রাখেন এবং মূলগ্রন্থ তাঁর কাছেই রয়েছে।
null.verse 13:40: আমি তাদের সাথে যে ওয়াদা করেছি, তার কোন একটি যদি আপনাকে দেখিয়ে দেই কিংবা আপনাকে উঠিয়ে নেই, তাতে কি আপনার দায়িত্ব তো পৌছে দেয়া এবং আমার দায়িত্ব হিসাব নেয়া।
null.verse 13:41: তারা কি দেখে না যে, আমি তাদের দেশকে চতুর্দিক থেকে সমানে সঙ্কুচিত করে আসছি? আল্লাহ নির্দেশ দেন। তাঁর নির্দেশকে পশ্চাতে নিক্ষেপকারী কেউ নেই। তিনি দ্রুত হিসাব গ্রহণ করেন।
null.verse 13:42: তাদের পূর্বে যারা ছিল, তারা চক্রান্ত করেছে। আর সকল চক্রান্ত তো আল্লাহর হাতেই আছে। তিনি জানেন প্রত্যেক ব্যক্তি যা কিছু করে। কাফেররা জেনে নেবে যে, পর জীবনের আবাসস্থল কাদের জন্য রয়েছে।
null.verse 13:43: কাফেররা বলেঃ আপনি প্রেরিত ব্যক্তি নন। বলে দিন, আমার ও তোমাদের মধ্যে প্রকৃষ্ট সাক্ষী হচ্ছেন আল্লাহ এবং ঐ ব্যক্তি, যার কাছে গ্রন্থের জ্ঞান আছে। রয়েছে।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 13:2: Аллах е, Който въздигна небесата без видима за вас опора.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 13:3: Той на Трона и покори слънцето и луната, всяко да се движи до определен срок.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 13:4: Той е, Който разпростря земята и стори по нея непоклатими планини и реки, и от всички плодове стори там по два вида.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 13:5: По земята има съседни участъци и градини с грозде, и посеви, и палми с общ корен и поотделно, поливани с една вода.

null.verse 13:2: 真主建立諸天，而不用你們所能看見的支柱。隨後他端坐在寶座上，制服日月，使其各自運行到一個定期。他處理萬事，解釋蹟象，以便你們確信將與你們的主相會。
null.verse 13:3: 他展開大地，並在大地上安置許多山岳和河流，他把每種果實造成兩性的，他以黑夜覆蓋白晝。對於能思維的民眾，此中確有許多蹟象。
null.verse 13:4: 大地上有許多鄰近的區域，有葡萄園，有莊稼，有椰棗樹，其中有二株同根生的，二株異根生的，（這些都是）用同樣的水灌溉的，我卻使這一部分果實比那一部分佳美。對於能理解的民眾，此中確有許多蹟象。
null.verse 13:5: 如果你感到驚訝，那末，他們的這句話才是奇怪的：「當我們變成為塵土的時候，我們必定要重新受造嗎？」這等人是不信他們的主的，這等人是要帶枷鎖的；這等人是居住火獄的，他們將永居其中。
null.verse 13:6: 在恩惠降臨之前，他們要求你早日昭示懲罰。許多懲戒處罰在他們之前確已逝去了。眾人雖然不義，但你的主對於他們確是饒恕的。你的主的懲罰確是嚴厲的。
null.verse 13:7: 不信道者說：「為甚麼沒有一種蹟象，從他的主降臨他呢？」你只是一個警告者，每個民族都有一個引導者。
null.verse 13:8: 真主知道每個女性的懷孕，和子宮的收縮和膨脹。在主那裡，萬物是各有定量的。
null.verse 13:9: 他是全知幽明的，是偉大的，是崇高的。
null.verse 13:10: 你們中竊竊私語的，高談闊論的，隱藏在黑夜的，出現在白晝的，（在他）看來都是一樣的。
null.verse 13:11: 每個人的前面和後面，都有許多接踵而來的天神，他們奉真主的命令來監護他。真主必定不變更任何民眾的情況，直到他們變更自己的情況。當真主欲降災害於任何民眾的時候，那災害是不可抗拒的。除真主外，他們絕無保佑者。
null.verse 13:12: 他是以電光昭示你們，以引起你們的恐懼和希望，並興起密雲。
null.verse 13:13: 雷霆在讚頌真主超絕萬物，眾天神因為畏懼他而讚頌他。他發出霹靂以擊殺他所意欲者。他們為主而爭論，而他是有強大謀略的。
null.verse 13:14: 真實的祈禱只歸於他，他們捨他而祈禱的（偶像），一點也不能答應他們的祈求。但他們好像一個人，把兩隻手掌伸向水中，以便水達到他的口，其實，水絕不會達到他的口的。不信道者的祈禱，只在迷誤中。
null.verse 13:15: 凡在天地間的萬物，都順服地或勉強地為真主而叩頭，他們的陰影也朝夕為他而叩頭。※
null.verse 13:16: 你說：「誰是天地的主？」你說：「真主。」你說：「難道你們捨真主而把那些不能自主禍福者當作保祐者嗎？」你說，「盲人與非盲人是一樣的嗎？黑暗與光明是一樣的嗎？」他們為真主樹立了許多伙伴，難道那些伙伴能像真主那樣創造萬物，以致他們分辨不出兩種創造嗎？你說：「真主是萬物的創造者，他確是獨一的，確是萬能的。」
null.verse 13:17: 真主從雲中降下雨水，一切溝壑就盡量流行。山洪載著浮渣——他們為制造首飾和器皿而熔化的金屬，也有同樣的浮渣。真主如此闡明真偽——至於渣滓則被沖走，至於有益於人的東西則留存在地面上。真主如此闡明許多比喻。
null.verse 13:18: 已經答應真主的人，將受極美的報酬；沒有答應主的人，假若天地上的一切鄙歸他們所有，再加上一倍，他們必定都用來做贖金。這等人將受嚴厲的清算，他們的歸宿是火獄，那床鋪真糟糕！
null.verse 13:19: 從你的主降示你的，正是真理，難道認識這個道理者跟盲人是一樣的嗎？唯有理智菩才能記住。

null.verse 13:23: 常住的樂園，他們將進入樂園。他們的祖先、妻子和後裔中的善良者，都將進入樂園。眾天神從每道門進去見他們，
null.verse 13:24: （說）：「祝你們平安！這是你們因堅忍而得的報酬，後世的善果真優美。」
null.verse 13:25: 與真主締約，然後加以破壞的，斷絕真主命人連結者的，在地方上進行破壞的，這等人將被詛咒，將吃後世的惡果。
null.verse 13:26: 真主使他所意欲者享受寬裕的給養或窘迫的給養。他們因今世的生活而歡喜，然而今世的生活比起後世的生活來，只是一種（暫時）的享受。
null.verse 13:27: 不信道的人們說：「怎麼沒有一種蹟象從他的主降臨他呢？」你說：「真主必定使他所意欲者誤入迷途，必定使歸依他的人走上正路。」
null.verse 13:28: 他們信道，他們的心境因記憶真主而安靜，真的，一切心境因記憶真主而安靜。
null.verse 13:29: 信道而且行善者，得享幸福和優美的歸宿。
null.verse 13:30: 我這樣派遣你去教化一個民族，在他們之前有許多民族確已逝去了，以便你對他們宣讀我所啟示你的經典，他們是不信至仁主的。你說：「他是我的主，除他之外，絕無應受崇拜的。我只信托他，我只以他為依歸。」
null.verse 13:31: 假若有一部《古蘭經》，可用來移動山岳，或破裂大地，或使死人說話，（他們必不信它）。不然，一切事情只歸真主，難道信道的人們不知道嗎？假若真主意欲，地必引導全人類。不信道的人們還要因自己的行為而遭受災殃，或他們住宅的附近遭受災殃，直到真主的應許到來。真主確是不爽約的。
null.verse 13:32: 在你之前，有許多使者確已被人嘲弄了，俱我對不信道者緩刑。隨後，我懲治他們。我的懲罰是怎樣的呢？
null.verse 13:33: 監視每個靈魂的謀求者，難道像那不能監視的嗎？他們為真主樹立了許多伙伴，你說：「你們指出他們的名稱吧。難道你們把真主在大地上所不知道的告訴他嗎？不然，你們據浮辭而稱他們為真主的伙伴。」不然，不信道者，已為自己的計謀所迷惑了。他們被阻撓而不能入正道。真主使誰迷誤，誰就沒有向導。
null.verse 13:34: 他們在今世將受懲罰，後世的懲罰確是更嚴厲的。他們絕無任何保衛者以抗拒真主。
null.verse 13:35: 已應許敬畏者的樂園，其情狀是這樣的：那樂園下臨諸河，其中的果實是永恆的，其中的蔭影也是永恆的。這是敬畏者的果報；不信道者的果報是火獄。
null.verse 13:36: 蒙我賞賜經典的人喜歡降示給你的經典，同盟者當中，有人否認這經典的一部分。你說：「我只奉命崇拜真主，而不以物配他，我只號召人崇拜他，我只歸依他。」
null.verse 13:37: 我這樣把它降示為阿拉伯文的智慧。在知識降臨你之後，如果你順從他們的欲望，那末，你對真主的（懲罰）絕無任何保護者，也絕無任何保衛者。
null.verse 13:38: 在你之前，我確已派遣了許多使者，並賞賜他們妻子和兒女。除非奉真主的命令，任何使者不能昭示蹟象。每個期限，各有判定。
null.verse 13:39: 真主任意勾銷和確定（經典的明文），在他那裡有天經的原本。
null.verse 13:40: 如果我把我用來恫嚇他們的刑罰昭示你一點兒，（那會使你滿意），如果我使你壽終，那麼，你只負傳達的責任，我自負清算的責任。
null.verse 13:41: 難道他們不知道嗎？我到他們的地方來縮小他們的邊境。真主自由判決，任何人不能反抗其判決。他是清算神速的。
null.verse 13:42: 在他們之前的人，確已使用計謀；但一切計謀，只歸真主，他知道每個靈魂的謀求。

null.verse 13:11: tak jako tak má pozorovatele před sebou i za sebou, kteří jej střeží z rozkazu Božího.
null.verse 13:12: On je ten, jenž ukazuje vám blesk pro strach i naději a dává vzniknout mračnům vodou obtěžkaným.
null.verse 13:13: A slaví hrom chválu Jeho a stejně činí i andělé z bázně před Ním.
null.verse 13:14: Jen Jemu patří vzývání pravé; ti, kdož vzývají něco jiného kromě Něho, nebudou v ničem vyslyšeni, stejně jako voda nedospěje k ústům toho, jenž po ní dlaně své vztahuje, ona však není v dosahu jeho, vždyť vzývání nevěřících jen bludem je.
null.verse 13:15: A sklání se před Bohem vše, co na nebesích i na zemi je, dobrovolně či nuceně, a stejně tak i stíny jejich, za jitra časného i večera pozdního.
null.verse 13:16: Rci: "Kdo Pánem je nebes a země?" Odpověz: "Bůh!" Rci: "Chcete si vzít vedle Něho ochránce, kteří nemohou prospět ani uškodit ni sobě samým?" Rci: "Cožpak jsou si rovni slepý a vidoucí či rovná se temnota světlu?" Což budou přidružovat k Bohu společníky, kteří snad stvořili něco podobného Jeho stvoření, takže se obě tvoření zdají podobná? Rci: "Bůh všech věcí je stvořitelem a On je jediný, vše podmaňující.
null.verse 13:17: On z nebe vodu sesílá, aby tekla v údolích podle rozměrů jejich; proud pak odnáší pěnu na hladině plující.
null.verse 13:18: Ti, kdož uposlechnou výzvy Pána svého, obdrží odměnu nejkrásnější, ti však, kdož Jeho neuposlechnou i kdyby jim patřilo všechno na zemi a ještě jednou tolik, se nebudou moci tím vykoupit.
null.verse 13:19: Je ten, jenž ví, že to, co ti bylo sesláno od Pána tvého, je pravda, podoben slepci? To připomenou si věru lidé rozmyslem nadaní,
null.verse 13:20: ti, kdož věrně úmluvu s Bohem dodržují a smlouvy své neporušují,
null.verse 13:21: i ti, kdož spojují to, co Bůh přikázal, aby bylo spojeno, a Pána svého a účtováni hrozného se obávají,
null.verse 13:22: i ti, kdož vytrvalí jsou ve své touze spatřit tvář Pána svého, modlitbu dodržují a z toho, co jsme jim uštědřili, tajně i veřejně rozdávají a zlé dobrým odhánějí - pro ty uchystán je příbytek konečný
null.verse 13:23: zahrady Edenu.
null.verse 13:24: zdravíce: "Mír s vámi za to, že trpěliví jste byli!" A jak překrásný bude příbytek konečný!
null.verse 13:25: Avšak ti, kdož úmluvu s Bohem porušují po jejím uzavření, kdož přetrhávají svazky, jež Bůh nařídil, aby byly spojeny, a ti, kdož pohoršení na zemi šíří, ti nechť jsou prokleti a nechť příbytek mají odporný!
null.verse 13:26: Bůh hojně uštědřuje či odměřuje obživu, komu chce.
null.verse 13:27: Ti, kdož nevěří, říkají: "Pročpak mu nebylo sesláno znamení nějaké od Pána jeho?" Rci: "Bůh dává zbloudit, komu chce, a vede k Sobě toho, kdo obrátil se s pokáním,
null.verse 13:28: a ty, kdož uvěřili a jichž srdce se uklidňují při vzpomínce na Boha - jak jinak, než vzpomínkou na Boha se mohou srdce uklidnit? -
null.verse 13:29: a ty, kdož uvěřili a dobré skutky konali; těm dostane se blaženosti a překrásného místa pobytu.
null.verse 13:30: Takto jsme tě vyslali k národu, před nímž již zanikly národy jiné, abys jim přednesl to, co jsme ti vnukli, zatímco oni nevěří v Milosrdného.
null.verse 13:31: A kdyby mohly být Koránem uvedeny na pochod hory či kdyby jím byla země rozpolcená či mohli by jeho pomocí promluvit mrtví.
null.verse 13:32: Lidé se posmívali již poslům, kteří přišli před tebou, a povolil jsem nevěřícím odklad, potom však jsem je uchvátil a jaký byl trest Můj?
null.verse 13:33: Což ten, jenž dozírá nad duší každou a tím, co si vysloužila.
null.verse 13:34: Pro ně je určen trest v životě pozemském; avšak trest v životě budoucím bude ještě horší a nebudou mít proti Bohu ochránce žádného.
null.verse 13:35: Toto je obraz ráje, jenž přislíben byl bohabojným: pod zahradami jeho řeky tekou a plody trvalé jsou stejně jako stíny jeho.
null.verse 13:36: Ti, jimž dali jsme Písmo, se radují z toho, co ti bylo sesláno, zatímco mezi spojenci jsou někteří, kdož část toho zavrhují.
null.verse 13:37: A takto jsme seslali Korán jako moudrost v arabštině; a kdybys následoval scestná učení jejich poté, co dostalo se ti vědění, věru nebudeš mít proti Bohu ochránce ani obhájce žádného.
null.verse 13:38: A již před tebou jsme vyslali posly a dali jsme jim manželky i potomstvo.
null.verse 13:39: Bůh vymazává i potvrzuje to, co chce, a u Něho je Kniha původní.
null.verse 13:40: A buď ti ukážeme část z toho, čím jim hrozíme, anebo tě k Sobě povoláme dříve - tobě přísluší toliko sdělování, Nám pak zúčtování.
null.verse 13:41: Což nevidí, jak pronikáme do země a na krajích ji ubíráme? Bůh rozsuzuje, a není nikoho, kdo by se mohl vzepřít rozhodnutí Jeho - a On rychlý je v účtování.
null.verse 13:42: Také ti, kdož před nimi byli, úklady strojili, avšak Bohu jsou známy veškeré úklady a On dobře zná, co duše každá si vysloužila.
null.verse 13:43: Ti, kdož nevěří, říkají: "Ty nejsi žádný vyslanec Boží!" Rci: "Bůh stačí mi jako svědek mezi mnou a vámi i těmi, kdož znalost Písma mají!" konečný.

null.verse 13:2: God is Hij, Die de hemelen heeft doen verrijzen zonder pilaren die je kunt zien.
null.verse 13:3: En Hij is het, Die de aarde uitspreidde, er bergen op verhief en rivieren op vormde.
null.verse 13:4: En er zijn op aarde aan elkaar grenzende streken en tuinen van wijnstokken, en korenvelden en dadelpalmen, met één wortel of met verschillende wortels, zij worden met hetzelfde water besproeid en toch doen Wij sommigen er van in fruit boven anderen uitmunten.
null.verse 13:5: En indien je je verwondert, dan is hun zeggen verwonderlijker: "Wanneer wij stof zijn geworden, zullen wij dan opnieuw worden geschapen?" Deze zijn het, die hun Heer hebben verworpen, daarom zullen zij ketenen om hun hals hebben en de bewoners van het Vuur zijn; daarin zullen zij vertoeven.
null.verse 13:6: En zij vragen eerder het kwade van u dan het goede; hoewel er voor hen voorbeeldige straffen zijn voorgekomen.
null.verse 13:7: En de ongelovigen zeggen: "Waarom is hem (de profeet) geen teken van zijn Heer neergezonden?" U bent waarlijk een waarschuwer en er is voor elk volk een leidsman.
null.verse 13:8: God weet wat elke vrouw baart en wat de baarmoeders niet voldragen en wat zij doen groeien.
null.verse 13:9: Hij is de Kenner van het onzienlijke en het zienlijke, de Grote, de Verhevene.
null.verse 13:10: Voor Hem is hij gelijk die onder u het woord verbergt en hij die het openlijk uit; alsook hij, die zich ’s nachts verbergt en hij, die overdag (openlijk) voortgaat.
null.verse 13:11: Er zijn voor hem (de Boodschapper) bewakers (engelen) vóór en achter hem; zij bewaken hem door het gebod van God.
null.verse 13:12: Hij is het, Die u de bliksem toont vrees en hoop veroorzakende en Hij doet zware wolken ontstaan.
null.verse 13:13: En de donder verkondigt Zijn glorie met de lof die Hem toekomt, en de engelen doen het uit ontzag voor Hem en Hij zendt de bliksem en treft er mede, wie Hij wil; nog steeds redetwisten zij over God.
null.verse 13:14: Tot Hem is het ware gebed.
null.verse 13:15: En wie in de hemelen en op aarde is, onderwerpt zich willens of onwillens aan God en hun schaduwen doen ’s morgens en ’s avonds hetzelfde.
null.verse 13:16: Zeg: "Wie is de Heer der hemelen en der aarde?" Zeg: "God.
null.verse 13:17: Hij zendt water van de hemel neer, zodat stromen overeenkomstig hun afmeting vloeien en de vloed zwellend schuim draagt.
null.verse 13:18: Er zal voor degenen die aan hun Heer gehoor geven het goede zijn, en degenen, die Hem geen gehoor geven - deze zouden, indien zij al hetgeen op aarde is en het gelijke er aan toegevoegd, bezaten, het gaarne als losprijs aanbieden.
null.verse 13:19: Is dan hij die weet, dat hetgeen u van uw Heer is geopenbaard de waarheid is, gelijk aan hem die blind is? Alleen degenen die met begrip zijn begiftigd trekken er lering uit,
null.verse 13:20: Degenen, die God’s verbond vervullen en dit niet breken.
null.verse 13:21: En degenen, die verbinden, wat God bevolen heeft verbonden te worden en die hun Heer vrezen en de kwade afrekening duchten.
null.verse 13:22: En degenen, die volharden in het zoeken naar de gunst van hun Heer en het gebed houden en van hetgeen waarvan Wij hen hebben voorzien, heimelijk en openlijk weggeven en die het kwade met het goede afwenden, dezen zijn het die de beloning en het goede tehuis zullen ontvangen.
null.verse 13:23: Tuinen der eeuwigheid.
null.verse 13:24: "Vrede zij over u, omdat je geduldig waart; ziet, hoe uitstekend is het uiteindelijke tehuis.
null.verse 13:25: En degenen, die het verbond van God breken nadat zij het hadden bevestigd en hetgeen God heeft bevolen verenigd te zijn, afsnijden en op aarde wanorde stichten, hen treft de vloek en zij zullen een slecht tehuis hebben.
null.verse 13:26: God vergroot en vermindert de voorziening voor wie Hem behaagt.
null.verse 13:27: En degenen die niet geloven, zeggen: "Waarom is hem (de profeet) geen teken van zijn Heer neergezonden?" Zeg: "God laat diegene dwalen die Hij wil en leidt tot Zichzelf degene die zich bekeert.
null.verse 13:28: Degenen die geloven, en wier hart rust vindt in de gedachtenis aan God.
null.verse 13:29: Degenen die geloven en goede werken doen - voor hen is geluk en een uitstekende plaats van terugkeer.
null.verse 13:30: Zo hebben Wij u tot een volk gezonden - aan hetwelk andere volkeren zijn voorafgegaan - opdat je hun hetgeen Wij u hebben geopenbaard, moogt verkondigen doch zij verwerpen de Barmhartige.
null.verse 13:31: En als er een Koran was, waarmee de bergen konden worden verzet, de aarde kon worden gespleten, of de doden tot spreken konden worden gebracht, (zouden zij er nog niet in geloven).
null.verse 13:32: Voorzeker boodschappers werden vóór u ook bespot, maar Ik schonk uitstel aan de ongelovigen.
null.verse 13:33: Zal Hij, Die over elke ziel waakt ten aanzien van hetgeen zij verdient (hen dan laten gaan)? Toch kennen zij medegoden aan God toe.
null.verse 13:34: Er is voor hen een straf in het tegenwoordige leven; doch de straf van het Hiernamaals is gewis zwaarder en zij zullen tegen God geen verdediger hebben.
null.verse 13:35: Het beeld van de Hemel die de godvrezenden is beloofd, is, dat er stromen in vloeien, en dat zijn fruit en schaduw eeuwigdurend zijn.
null.verse 13:36: En degenen, wie Wij het Boek hebben gegeven, verheugen zich in hetgeen u is geopenbaard.
null.verse 13:37: En zo hebben Wij het als een duidelijk oordeel geopenbaard.
null.verse 13:38: En Wij zonden inderdaad boodschappers vóór u en Wij gaven hun vrouwen en kinderen.
null.verse 13:39: God doet te niet wat Hij wil en bevestigt wat Hij wil en bij Hem is de oorsprong van het Boek.
null.verse 13:40: Of Wij u sommige der dingen doen zien waarmee Wij hen hebben bedreigd, of u doen sterven - op u rust (alleen) de verkondiging (der boodschap) en op Ons de verrekening.
null.verse 13:41: Zien zij niet dat Wij tot hun land komen, het van de buitenste zijden (grenzen) verminderend God besluit en niemand kan Zijn besluit omverwerpen.
null.verse 13:42: En degenen, die vóór hen waren, verzonnen plannen, maar (het slagen van) alle plannen berust bij God.
null.verse 13:43: De ongelovigen zeggen: "U bent geen gezant.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:2: Allah it is Who raised up the heavens without visible supports, then mounted the Throne, and compelled the sun and the moon to be of service, each runneth unto an appointed term; He ordereth the course; He detaileth the revelations, that haply ye may be certain of the meeting with your Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:3: And He it is Who spread out the earth and placed therein firm hills and flowing streams, and of all fruits He placed therein two spouses (male and female).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:4: And in the Earth are neighbouring tracts, vineyards and ploughed lands, and date-palms, like and unlike, which are watered with one water.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:5: And if thou wonderest, then wondrous is their saying: When we are dust, are we then forsooth (to be raised) in a new creation ? Such are they who disbelieve in their Lord; such have carcans on their necks; such are rightful owners of the Fire, they will abide therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:6: And they bid thee hasten on the evil rather than the good, when exemplary punishments have indeed occurred before them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:7: Those who disbelieve say: If only some portent were sent down upon him from his Lord! Thou art a warner only, and for every folk a guide.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:8: Allah knoweth that which every female beareth and that which the wombs absorb and that which they grow.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:9: He is the Knower of the Invisible and the Visible, the Great, the High Exalted.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:10: Alike of you is he who hideth the saying and he who noiseth it abroad, he who lurketh in the night and he who goeth freely in the daytime.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:11: For him are angels ranged before him and behind him, who guard him by Allah’s command.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:12: He it is Who showeth you the lightning, a fear and a hope, and raiseth the heavy clouds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:13: The thunder hymneth His praise and (so do) the angels for awe of Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:14: Unto Him is the real prayer.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:15: And unto Allah falleth prostrate whosoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, as do their shadows in the morning and the evening hours.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:16: Say (O Muhammad): Who is Lord of the heavens and the earth ? Say: Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:17: He sendeth down water from the sky, so that valleys flow according to their measure, and the flood beareth (on its surface) swelling foam - from that which they smelt in the fire in order to make ornaments and tools riseth a foam like unto it - thus Allah coineth (the similitude of) the true and the false.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:18: For those who answered Allah’s call is bliss; and for those who answered not His call, if they had all that is in the earth, and therewith the like thereof, they would proffer it as ransom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:19: Is he who knoweth that what is revealed unto thee from thy Lord is the truth like him who is blind ? But only men of understanding heed;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:20: Such as keep the pact of Allah, and break not the covenant;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:21: Such as unite that which Allah hath commandeth should be joined, and fear their Lord, and dread a woeful reckoning;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:22: Such as persevere in seeking their Lord’s Countenance and are regular in prayer and spend of that which We bestow upon them secretly and openly, and overcome evil with good.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:23: Gardens of Eden which they enter, along with all who do right of their fathers and their helpmeets and their seed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:24: (Saying): Peace be unto you because ye persevered.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:25: And those who break the covenant of Allah after ratifying it, and sever that which Allah hath commanded should be joined, and make mischief in the earth: theirs is the curse and theirs the ill abode.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:26: Allah enlargeth livelihood for whom He will, and straiteneth (it for whom He will); and they rejoice in the life of the world, whereas the life of the world is but brief comfort as compared with the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:27: Those who disbelieve say: If only a portent were sent down upon him from his Lord! Say: Lo! Allah sendeth whom He will astray, and guideth unto Himself all who turn (unto Him),
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:28: Who have believed and whose hearts have rest in the remembrance of Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:29: Those who believe and do right: Joy is for them, and bliss (their) journey’s end.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:30: Thus We send thee (O Muhammad) unto a nation, before whom other nations have passed away, that thou mayst recite unto them that which We have inspired in thee, while they are disbelievers in the Beneficent.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:31: Had it been possible for a Lecture to cause the mountains to move, or the earth to be torn asunder, or the dead to speak, (this Qur’an would have done so).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:32: And verily messengers (of Allah) were mocked before thee, but long I bore with those who disbelieved.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:33: Is He Who is aware of the deserts of every soul (as he who is aware of nothing) ? Yet they ascribe unto Allah partners.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:34: For them is torment in the life of the world, and verily the doom of the Hereafter is more painful, and they have no defender from Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:35: A similitude of the Garden which is promised unto those who keep their duty (to Allah): Underneath it rivers flow; its food is everlasting, and its shade; this is the reward of those who keep their duty, while the reward of disbelievers is the Fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:36: Those unto whom We gave the Scripture rejoice in that which is revealed unto thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:37: Thus have We revealed it, a decisive utterance in Arabic; and if thou shouldst follow their desires after that which hath come unto thee of knowledge, then truly wouldst thou have from Allah no protecting friend nor defender.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:38: And verily We sent messengers (to mankind) before thee, and We appointed for them wives and offspring, and it was not (given) to any messenger that he should bring a portent save by Allah’s leave.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:39: Allah effaceth what He will, and establisheth (what He will), and with Him is the source of ordinance.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:40: Whether We let thee see something of that which We have promised them, or make thee die (before its happening), thine is but conveyance (of the message).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:41: See they not how we aim to the land, reducing it of its outlying parts ? (When) Allah doometh there is none that can postpone His doom, and He is swift at reckoning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:42: Those who were before them plotted; but all plotting is Allah’s.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 13:43: They who disbelieve say: Thou art no messenger (of Allah).

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:2: God is He Who raised the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; is firmly established on the throne (of authority); He has subjected the sun and the moon (to his Law)! Each one runs (its course) for a term appointed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:3: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o’er the Day.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:4: And in the earth are tracts (diverse though) neighbouring, and gardens of vines and fields sown with corn, and palm trees - growing out of single roots or otherwise: watered with the same water, yet some of them We make more excellent than others to eat.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:5: If thou dost marvel (at their want of faith), strange is their saying: "When we are (actually) dust, shall we indeed then be in a creation renewed?" They are those who deny their Lord! They are those round whose necks will be yokes (of servitude): they will be Companions of the Fire, to dwell therein (for aye)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:6: They ask thee to hasten on the evil in preference to the good: Yet have come to pass, before them, (many) exemplary punishments! But verily thy Lord is full of forgiveness for mankind for their wrong-doing, and verily thy Lord is (also) strict in punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:7: And the Unbelievers say: "Why is not a sign sent down to him from his Lord?" But thou art truly a warner, and to every people a guide.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:8: God doth know what every female (womb) doth bear, by how much the wombs fall short (of their time or number) or do exceed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:9: He knoweth the unseen and that which is open: He is the Great, the Most High.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:10: It is the same (to Him) whether any of you conceal his speech or declare it openly; whether he lie hid by night or walk forth freely by day.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:11: For each (such person) there are (angels) in succession, before and behind him: They guard him by command of God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:12: It is He Who doth show you the lightning, by way both of fear and of hope: It is He Who doth raise up the clouds, heavy with (fertilising) rain!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:13: Nay, thunder repeateth His praises, and so do the angels, with awe: He flingeth the loud-voiced thunder-bolts, and therewith He striketh whomsoever He will.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:14: For Him (alone) is prayer in Truth: any others that they call upon besides Him hear them no more than if they were to stretch forth their hands for water to reach their mouths but it reaches them not: for the prayer of those without Faith is nothing but (futile) wandering (in the mind).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:15: Whatever beings there are in the heavens and the earth do prostrate themselves to God (Acknowledging subjection),- with good-will or in spite of themselves: so do their shadows in the morning and evenings.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:16: Say: "Who is the Lord and Sustainer of the heavens and the earth?" Say: "(It is) God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:17: He sends down water from the skies, and the channels flow, each according to its measure: But the torrent bears away to foam that mounts up to the surface.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:18: For those who respond to their Lord, are (all) good things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:19: Is then one who doth know that that which hath been revealed unto thee from thy Lord is the Truth, like one who is blind? It is those who are endued with understanding that receive admonition;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:20: Those who fulfil the covenant of God and fail not in their plighted word;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:21: Those who join together those things which God hath commanded to be joined, hold their Lord in awe, and fear the terrible reckoning;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:22: Those who patiently persevere, seeking the countenance of their Lord; Establish regular prayers; spend, out of (the gifts) We have bestowed for their sustenance, secretly and openly; and turn off Evil with good: for such there is the final attainment of the (eternal) home,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:23: Gardens of perpetual bliss: they shall enter there, as well as the righteous among their fathers, their spouses, and their offspring: and angels shall enter unto them from every gate (with the salutation):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:24: "Peace unto you for that ye persevered in patience! Now how excellent is the final home!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:25: But those who break the Covenant of God, after having plighted their word thereto, and cut asunder those things which God has commanded to be joined, and work mischief in the land;- on them is the curse; for them is the terrible home!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:26: God doth enlarge, or grant by (strict) measure, the sustenance (which He giveth) to whomso He pleaseth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:27: The Unbelievers say: "Why is not a sign sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "Truly God leaveth, to stray, whom He will; But He guideth to Himself those who turn to Him in penitence,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:28: "Those who believe, and whose hearts find satisfaction in the remembrance of God: for without doubt in the remembrance of God do hearts find satisfaction.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:29: "For those who believe and work righteousness, is (every) blessedness, and a beautiful place of (final) return.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:30: Thus have we sent thee amongst a People before whom (long since) have (other) Peoples (gone and) passed away; in order that thou mightest rehearse unto them what We send down unto thee by inspiration; yet do they reject (Him), the Most Gracious! Say: "He is my Lord! There is no god but He! On Him is my trust, and to Him do I turn!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:31: If there were a Qur’an with which mountains were moved, or the earth were cloven asunder, or the dead were made to speak, (this would be the one!) But, truly, the command is with God in all things! Do not the Believers know, that, had God (so) willed, He could have guided all mankind (to the right)? But the Unbelievers,- never will disaster cease to seize them for their (ill) deeds, or to settle close to their homes, until the promise of God come to pass, for, verily, God will not fail in His promise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:32: Mocked were (many) apostles before thee: but I granted respite to the unbelievers, and finally I punished them: Then how (terrible) was my requital!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:33: Is then He who standeth over every soul (and knoweth) all that it doth, (like any others)? And yet they ascribe partners to God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:34: For them is a penalty in the life of this world, but harder, truly, is the penalty of the Hereafter: and defender have they none against God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:35: The parable of the Garden which the righteous are promised!- beneath it flow rivers: perpetual is the enjoyment thereof and the shade therein: such is the end of the Righteous; and the end of Unbelievers in the Fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:36: Those to whom We have given the Book rejoice at what hath been revealed unto thee: but there are among the clans those who reject a part thereof.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:37: Thus have We revealed it to be a judgment of authority in Arabic.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:38: We did send apostles before thee, and appointed for them wives and children: and it was never the part of an apostle to bring a sign except as God permitted (or commanded).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:39: God doth blot out or confirm what He pleaseth: with Him is the Mother of the Book.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:40: Whether We shall show thee (within thy life-time) part of what we promised them or take to ourselves thy soul (before it is all accomplished),- thy duty is to make (the Message) reach them: it is our part to call them to account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:41: See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? (Where) God commands, there is none to put back His Command: and He is swift in calling to account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:42: Those before them did (also) devise plots; but in all things the master-planning is God’s He knoweth the doings of every soul: and soon will the Unbelievers know who gets home in the end.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 13:43: The Unbelievers say: "No apostle art thou.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:2: God is He who raised up the heavens without pillars you can see, then He sat Himself upon the Throne.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:3: It is He who stretched out the earth and set therein firm mountains and rivers, and of every fruit He placed there two kinds, covering the day with the night.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:4: And on the earth are tracts neighbouring each to each, and gardens of vines, and fields sown, and palms in pairs, and palms single, watered with one water; and some of them We prefer in produce above others.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:5: If thou wouldst wonder, surely wonderful is their saying, ’What, when we are dust shall we indeed then be raised up again in new creation?’ Those are they that disbelieve in their Lord; those -- on their necks are fetters; those shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, therein dwelling forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:6: They would have thee hasten the evil ere the good; yet there have passed away before them examples.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:7: The unbelievers say, ’Why has a sign not been sent down upon him from his Lord?’ Thou art only a warner, and a guide to every people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:8: God knows what every female bears, and the wombs’ shrinking and swelling; everything with Him has its measure --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:9: the Knower of the unseen and the visible, the All-great, the All-exalted:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:10: Alike of you is he who conceals his -- saying, and he who proclaims it, he who hides himself in the night, and he who sallies by day;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:11: he has attendant angels, before him and behind him, watching over him by God’s command.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:12: It is He who shows you the lightning, for fear and hope, and produces the heavy clouds;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:14: To Him is the call of truth; and those upon whom they call, apart from Him, answer them nothing, but it is as a man who stretches out his hands to water that it may reach his mouth, and it reaches it not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:15: To God bow all who are in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, as do their shadows also in the mornings and the evenings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:16: Say: ’Who is the Lord of the heavens and of the earth?’ Say: ’God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:17: He sends down out of heaven water, and the wadis flow each in its measure, and the torrent carries a swelling scum; and out of that over which they kindle fire, being desirous of ornament or ware, out of that rises a scum the like of it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:18: For those who answer their Lord, the reward most fair; and those who answer Him not -- if they possessed all that is in the earth and the like of it with it, they would offer it for their ransom.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:19: What, is he who knows what is sent down to thee from thy Lord is the truth, like him who is blind? Only men possessed of minds remember;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:20: who fulfil God’s covenant, and break not the compact,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:21: who join what God has commanded shall be joined, and fear their Lord, and dread the evil reckoning,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:22: patient men, desirous of the Face of their Lord, who perform the prayer, and expend of that We have provided them, secretly and in public, and who avert evil with good -- theirs shall be the Ultimate Abode,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:23: Gardens of Eden which they shall enter; and those who were righteous of their fathers, and their wives, and their seed, shall enter them, and the angels shall enter unto them from every gate:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:24: ’Peace be upon you, for that you were patient.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:25: And those who break the covenant of God after His compact, and who snap what God has commanded to be joined, and who work corruption in the earth -- theirs shall be the curse, and theirs the Evil Abode.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:26: God outspreads and straitens His provision unto whomsoever He will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:27: The unbelievers say, ’Why has a sign not been sent down upon him from his Lord?’ Say: ’God leads astray whomsoever He will, and He guides to Him all who are penitent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:28: Those who believe, their hearts being at rest in God’s remembrance -- in God’s remembrance are at rest the hearts
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:29: of those who believe and do righteous deeds; theirs is blessedness and a fair resort.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:30: Thus We have sent thee among a nation before which other nations have passed away, to recite to them that We have revealed to thee; and yet they disbelieve in the All-merciful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:31: If only a Koran whereby the mountains were set in motion, or the earth were cleft, or the dead were spoken to -- nay, but God’s is the affair altogether.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:32: Messengers indeed were scoffed at before thee, and I respited the unbelievers; then I seized them -- and how was my retribution?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:33: What, He who stands over every soul for what it has earned? -- And yet they ascribe to God associates.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:34: For them is chastisement in the present life; and the chastisement of the world to come is yet more grievous; they have none to defend them from God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:35: The likeness of Paradise, that is promised to the godfearing: beneath it rivers flow, its produce is eternal, and its shade.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:36: And those to whom We have given the Book rejoice in what is sent down unto thee; and of the parties some reject some of it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:37: Even so We have sent it down as an Arabic judgment.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:38: And We sent Messengers before thee, and We assigned to them wives, and seed; and it was not for any Messengers to bring a sign, but by God’s leave.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:39: God blots out, and He establishes whatsoever He will; and with Him is the Essence of the Book.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:40: Whether We show thee a part of that We promise them, or We call thee to Us, it is thine only to deliver the Message, and Ours the reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:41: Have they not seen how We come to the land diminishing it in its extremities? God judges; none repels His judgment; He is swift at the reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:42: Those that were before them devised; but God’s is the devising altogether.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 13:43: The unbelievers say, ’Thou art not an Envoy.

Muhammad Asad.verse 13:2: It is God who has raised the heavens without any supports that you could see, and is established on the throne of His almightiness; and He [it is who] has made the sun and the moon subservient [to His laws], each running its course for a term set [by Him].
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:3: And it is He who has spread the earth wide and placed on it firm mountains and running waters, and created thereon two sexes of every [kind of] plant; [and it is He who] causes the night to cover the day.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:5: tracts of land close by one another [and yet widely differing from one another]; and [there are on it] vineyards, and fields of grain, and date-palms growing in clusters from one root or standing alone,
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:6: watered with the same water: and yet, some of them have We favoured above others by way of the food [which they provide for man and beast].
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:7: BUT IF thou art amazed [at the marvels of God’s creation], amazing, too, is their saying, "What! After we have become dust, shall we indeed be [restored to life] in a new act of creation?" It is they who [thus show that they] are bent on denying their Sustainer; and it is they who carry the shackles [of their own making] around their necks; and it is they who are destined for the fire, therein to abide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:8: And [since, O Prophet, they are bent on denying the truth,] they challenge thee to hasten the coming upon them of evil instead of [hoping for] good – although [they ought to know that] the exemplary punishments [which they now deride] have indeed come to pass before their time.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:10: However, they who are bent on denying the truth [refuse to believe and] say, "Why has no miraculous sign ever been bestowed on him from on high by his Sustainer?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:11: thou art only a warner; and [in God] all people have a guide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:12: God knows what any female bears [in her womb], and by how much the wombs may fall short [in gestation], and by how much they may increase [the average period]: for with Him everything is
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:13: in accordance with its scope and purpose.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:14: He knows all that is beyond the reach of a created being’s perception as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature’s senses or mind – the Great One, the One far above anything that is or could ever be!
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:15: It is all alike [to Him] whether any of you conceals his thought or brings it into the open, and whether he seeks to hide [his evil deeds] under the cover of night or walks
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:17: (11) [thinking that] he has hosts of helpers – both such as can be perceived by him and such as are hidden from him – that could preserve him from whatever God may have willed.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:18: HE IT IS who displays before you the lightning, to give rise to
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:19: fear and hope, and calls heavy clouds into being;
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:20: and the thunder extols His limitless glory and praises Him, and [so do] the angels, in awe of Him; and He [it is who] lets loose the thunderbolts and strikes with them whom He wills.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:22: is due all prayer aiming at the Ultimate Truth, since those [other beings or powers] whom men invoke instead of God cannot respond to them in any way – [so that he who invokes them is] but like one who stretches his open hands towards water,
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:23: that it will reach his mouth, the while it never reaches him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:24: And before God prostrate themselves, willingly or unwillingly, all [things and beings] that are in the heavens and on earth, as do their shadows in the mornings and the evenings.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:25: Say "Who is the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth?" Say: "[It is] God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:26: then, do you take for your protectors, instead of Him, such as have it not within their power to bring benefit to, or avert harm from, themselves?" Say: "Can the blind and the seeing be deemed equal? – or can the depths of darkness and the light be deemed equal?" Or do they
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:27: believe that there are, side by side with God, other divine powers that have created the like of what He creates, so that this act of creation appears to them to be similar [to His]? Say: "God is the Creator of all things; and He is the One who holds absolute sway over all that exists.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:29: He sends down water from the sky, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:30: river-beds are running high according to their measure, the stream carries scum on its surface; and, likewise, from that
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:31: which they smelt in the fire in order to make ornaments or utensils, [there rises] scum.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:32: of those who have responded to their Sustainer with a goodly response, and of those who did not respond to Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:33: CAN, THEN, he who knows that whatever has been bestowed from on high upon thee by thy Sustainer is the truth be deemed equal to one who is blind? Only they who are endowed with insight keep this in mind:
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:34: they who are true to their bond with God and never break their covenant;
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:35: and who keep together what God has bidden to be joined, and stand in awe of their Sustainer and fear the most evil reckoning [which awaits such as do not respond to Him];
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:36: and who are patient in adversity out of a longing for their Sustainer’s countenance, and are constant in prayer, and spend on others, secretly and openly, out of what We provide for them as sustenance, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:38: gardens of perpetual bliss, which they shall enter together with the righteous from among their parents, their spouses, and their offspring; and the angels will come unto them from every gate [and will say]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:39: "Peace be upon you, because you have persevered!" How excellent, then, this fulfilment in the hereafter!
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:40: But as for those who break their bond with God after it has been established [in their nature], and cut asunder what God has bidden to be joined, and spread corruption on earth – their due is rejection [by God], and theirs is a most evil fate [in the life to come].
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:41: GOD GRANTS abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure, unto whomever He wills; and they [who are given abundance] rejoice in the life of this world – even though, as compared with the life to come, the life of this world is nought but a fleeting pleasure.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:42: NOW THOSE who are bent on denying the truth [of the Prophet’s message] say, "Why has no miraculous sign ever been bestowed upon him from on high by his Sustainer?" Say: "Behold, God lets go astray him who wills [to go astray], just as He guides unto Himself all who turn unto Him
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:43: those who believe, and whose hearts find their rest in the remembrance of God – for, verily, in the remembrance of God
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:45: [and so it is that] they who attain to faith and do righteous deeds are destined for happiness [in this world] and the most beauteous of all goals [in the life to come]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:46: Thus have We raised thee [O Muhammad] as Our Apostle amidst a community [of unbelievers] before whose time
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:47: communities have come and gone, so that thou might propound to them what We have revealed unto thee: for [in their ignorance] they deny the Most Gracious!Say: "He is my Sustainer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:48: Yet even if [they should listen to] a
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:49: discourse by which mountains could be moved, or the earth cleft asunder, or the dead made to speak – [they who are bent on denying the truth would still refuse to believe in it]! Nay, but God alone has the power to decide what shall be.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:50: deeds, sudden calamities will always befall them or will alight close to their homes; [and this will continue] until God’s promise [of resurrection] is fulfilled: verily, God never fails to fulfil His promise!
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:53: apostles been derided, and for a while I gave rein to those who were
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:54: bent on denying the truth: but then I took them to task – and how awesome was My retribution!
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:55: IS, THEN, HE who has every living being in His almighty care, [dealing with each] according to what it deserves – [is, then, He like anything else that exists]? And yet, they ascribe to other beings a share in God’s divinity! Say: "Give them any name [you please]: but do you [really think that you could] inform Him of anything on earth that He does not know – or [do you] but play with words?" Nay, goodly seems their false imagery to those who are bent on denying the truth, and so they are turned away from the
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:56: path: and he whom God lets go astray can never find any guide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:57: For such, there is suffering in the life of this world; but, truly,
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:58: suffering in the life to come will be harder still, and they will have none to shield them from God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:59: THE PARABLE of the paradise promised to those who are conscious of God [is that of a garden] through which running waters flow: [but, unlike an earthly garden,] its fruits will be everlasting, and [so will be] its shade.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:60: Hence, they unto whom We have vouchsafed this revelation rejoice at all that has been bestowed upon thee [O Prophet] from on high; but among the followers of other creeds there are such as deny the validity of some of it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:61: Thus, then, have We bestowed from on high this [divine writ] as an ordinance in the Arabic tongue.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:62: knowledge that has come unto thee, thou wouldst have none to protect thee from God, and none to shield thee [from Him].
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:63: And, truly, We sent forth apostles before thee, and We appointed for them wives and offspring; and it was not given to any apostle to produce a miracle save at God’s behest.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:64: God annuls or confirms whatever He wills [of His earlier messages] – for with Him is the source of all revelation.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:65: BUT WHETHER We let thee see [in thy lifetime, O Prophet, the fulfilment of] some of what We have promised them, or whether We cause thee to die [before its fulfilment] – thy duty is no more than to deliver the message; and the reckoning is Ours.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:66: Have, then, they [who deny the truth] never yet seen how We visit the earth [with Our punishment], gradually depriving it of all that is best thereon? For,
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:67: God judges, there is no power that could repel His judgment: and swift in reckoning is He!
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:68: Now those who lived before these
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:69: did, too, devise many a blasphemy – but the most subtle devising is that of God, who knows what each human being deserves: and the deniers of the truth will [in time] come to know to whom the future belongs.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:71: they who are bent on denying the truth say [unto thee, O Prophet], "Thou hast not been sent [by God]," say thou: "None can bear witness between me and you as God does; and [none can bear witness as does] he who truly understands this divine writ.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:73: that walks in the light of day, surrounded by hosts of helpers (mu‘aqqibāt) – that is, guards and aids – meant to protect him:
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:74: those guards of his cannot save him from [the will of] God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:78: communities have passed away”: an indirect reference to the continuity of prophetic revelation before and up to the time of the Last Prophet, Muhammad (Zamakhsharī, Rāzī).
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:81: law and way of life” – and the corresponding note 66, which explains the succession of divine messages culminating in, and ending with, the revelation of the Qur’ān.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:82: its sides” (min atrāfihā) – depending on whether one understands by atrāf the “sides” or “extremities” or “outlying parts” (of a concrete body or land) or, alternatively, the “outstanding men” – i.
Muhammad Asad.verse 13:84: its sides?” – which would imply a prophecy of the gradual conquest of all Arabia by the Muslims.

Martin Lings.verse 13:3: He sendeth down water from heaven, so that valleys are in flood with it, each according to its capacity.
Martin Lings.verse 13:4: sendeth down water from heaven, so that valleys are in flood with it, each according to its capacity, and the flood beareth swelling foam….

Martin Lings.verse 13:8: who believe and whose hearts rest in security in the remembrance of Allah.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:2: Allah is the One who raised the heavens without pillars that you can see them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:3: He is the One who spread out the earth and made mountains and rivers on it, and created in it the pairs of two from all the fruits.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:4: And in the earth there are tracts of land neighboring each other, and gardens of grapes, and farms and date palms, some having twin trunks and some having a single one.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:5: If you wonder, then wondrous indeed is their saying, “Is it that, once we are dust, we are to be created anew?” They are those who have disbelieved in their Lord, and they are those who (shall) have shackles around their necks, and they are the people of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:6: They ask for evil to come sooner than good, while punishments have really come to pass (against people) earlier to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:7: The disbelievers say, “Why is it that no sign has been sent down to him from his Lord?” You are but a warner; and for every people there is a guide.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:8: Allah knows what every female carries and what the wombs decrease or increase.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:9: He is the Knower of the hidden and the manifest.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:10: Alike (for Him) is he, from among you, who speaks quietly and he who speaks aloud, and he who hides in the night and he who walks out in the day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:11: For every one (from among you) there are angels replacing one another, in front of him and behind him, who guard him under the command of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:12: He is the One who makes you see the lightening in fear and hope, and who forms the heavy clouds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:13: The thunder proclaims His purity with His praise, and (so do) the angels, out of His awe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:14: True prayers are to be directed to Him alone; and those to whom they pray instead of Him do not respond to them at all, but they are like one who stretches his hands towards water so that it may reach his mouth (by itself), while it is not to reach it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:15: To Allah bow in prostration all who are in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and their shadows as well in morns and eves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:16: Say, “Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?” Say, “Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:17: He sent down water from the heavens, so the canals flowed according to their capacity, and the flood carried bulging scum.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:18: For those who obey their Lord there is the best of rewards; and those who do not obey Him (shall be in such a plight that) even if they possess all that is on earth, rather twice as much, they would offer it in ransom (to redeem themselves from the punishment).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:19: Now, can the one who knows that whatever has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, be equal to one who is blind? Only the people of understanding respond to the advice -
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:20: those who fulfill (their) pledge with Allah and do not break the covenant,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:21: and those who maintain the relationships Allah has commanded to be maintained and fear their Lord and are frightful of evil reckoning,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:22: and those who observe patience in order to seek the pleasure of their Lord and establish Salāh and spend secretly and openly from what We have given to them, and repel evil with good.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:23: the eternal gardens they enter, and those as well who are righteous from their fathers, spouses, and progeny.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 13:24: (saying) “Peace on you for the patience you observed.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 13:5: And if you wonder, then surely wondrous is their saying: ‘When we have become dust, shall we indeed then be
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 13:6: in a new creation?’ Those are the ones who disbelieve in their Lord; those — fetters shall be around their necks; and those, they shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, abiding therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 13:7: And they would have you hasten on the evil, rather than the good, when there have indeed occurred before them exemplary punishments.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 13:8: And those who disbelieve say, ‘Why has not some sign been sent down upon him from his Lord!’ You are only a warner, and for every folk there is a guide.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 13:13: For him are attendants, to his front and to his rear, guarding him through God’s command.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 13:14: He it is Who shows you the lightning,

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 13:16: And the thunder proclaims His praise, and so too the angels in awe of Him.
